get.description: Returns a list of MCP servers for the organization.
Returns the default MCP server for the organization. If not set, it will create a new one.

delete.description: Deletes an MCP server by its ID.

post.description: Sets the specified MCP server to the given Sandbox.

get.description: Returns a list of sandboxes for the organization.

delete.description: Deletes a sandbox by its ID.

get.description: Get the sandbox details by id

post.description: Extends a sandbox expire time by its ID.
Executes a computer use or mobile use action on the sandbox.
post.summary: Execute Computer Use or Mobile Use action

post.description: Takes a screenshot and gets cursor position of the sandbox.

get.description: Returns a list of projects for the organization.

delete.description: Deletes a project by its ID.

post.description: Parses the output text of computer use model and returns the parsed actions.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the prompt to parse the input for

post.description: Parses the output text of mobile use model and returns the parsed actions.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the prompt to parse the input for

post.summary: Parse Mobile Use Model Text Output

get.description: Returns the stats of the organization, such as number of members, computers, etc.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the MCP server.

defaultMcpServer.description: Whether this is the default MCP server for the organization.

projectId.description: Project ID to which the MCP server belongs.

sandboxShape.description: The shape of the sandbox created by the MCP server.

sandboxMaxLifetimeSeconds.description: The maximum lifetime of a sandbox.

sandboxMaxIdleTimeSeconds.description: The maximum idle time of a sandbox.

sandboxAutoCreation.description: Whether to create a new sandbox automatically when old sandbox is deleted. If not, new sandboxes will be created when calling computer use tools.

sandboxExposeRecreateTool.description: Whether to expose recreate tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeRestartTool.description: Whether to expose restart tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeDeleteTool.description: Whether to expose delete tool to LLMs.

currentSandboxId.description: ID of the currently connected sandbox.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the MCP server.

defaultMcpServer.description: Whether this is the default MCP server for the organization.

projectId.description: Project ID to which the MCP server belongs.

sandboxShape.description: The shape of the sandbox created by the MCP server.

sandboxMaxLifetimeSeconds.description: The maximum lifetime of a sandbox.

sandboxMaxIdleTimeSeconds.description: The maximum idle time of a sandbox.

sandboxAutoCreation.description: Whether to create a new sandbox automatically when old sandbox is deleted. If not, new sandboxes will be created when calling computer use tools.

sandboxExposeRecreateTool.description: Whether to expose recreate tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeRestartTool.description: Whether to expose restart tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeDeleteTool.description: Whether to expose delete tool to LLMs.

currentSandboxId.description: ID of the currently connected sandbox.

projectId.description: Project to which the MCP server belongs to.

sandboxShape.description: The shape of the sandbox created by the MCP server.

sandboxMaxLifetimeSeconds.description: The maximum lifetime of a sandbox.

sandboxMaxIdleTimeSeconds.description: The maximum idle time of a sandbox.

sandboxAutoCreation.description: Whether to create a new sandbox automatically when old sandbox is deleted. If not, new sandboxes will be created when calling computer use tools.

sandboxExposeRecreateTool.description: Whether to expose recreate tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeRestartTool.description: Whether to expose restart tool to LLMs.

sandboxExposeDeleteTool.description: Whether to expose delete tool to LLMs.

sandboxId.description: The ID of the sandbox to connect the MCP server to.

maxLifeSeconds.description: The maximum life time of the sandbox in seconds. Default is 1 hour, max is 1 day.

projectId.description: The project id to use for the sandbox. Use default if not provided.

shape.description: Specs and datacenter of the sandbox.

id.description: A caller-defined unique identifier for this item. The value is included in the response to associate results with their corresponding requests
unique identifier of the files item from the request

maxLifeSeconds.description: The new max life time of the sandbox (relative to the current time) in seconds. Should not less than 30 seconds or more than 24 hours. Note that the total maximum lifetime of a sandbox should not longer than 13 days.

pricePerHour.description: This price acts as a multiplier, e.g. if it is set to 0.5, each hour of usage will be billed as 0.5 hours.

action.description: All possible computer use actions, with optional callId

oneOf.description: Click the mouse at the specified coordinates

button.description: Mouse button flag combination. 1: left, 2: right, 4: middle, 8: back, 16: forward; add them together to press multiple buttons at once.

holdKey.description: Key to hold down during click, in xdotool key syntax. Example: "ctrl", "alt", "alt+shift".

relative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

oneOf.description: Double click the mouse at the specified coordinates

holdKey.description: Key to hold down during double click, in xdotool key syntax. Example: "ctrl", "alt", "alt+shift".

relative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

oneOf.description: Triple click the mouse at the specified coordinates

holdKey.description: Key to hold down during triple click, in xdotool key syntax. Example: "ctrl", "alt", "alt+shift".

relative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

oneOf.description: Move the mouse to the specified coordinates

holdKey.description: Key to hold down during move, in xdotool key syntax. Example: "ctrl", "alt", "alt+shift".

relative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

holdKey.description: Key to hold down during scroll, in xdotool key syntax. Example: "ctrl", "alt", "alt+shift".

relative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

oneOf.description: Drag the mouse from start to end coordinates

holdKey.description: Key to hold down during drag, in xdotool key syntax. Example: "ctrl", "alt", "alt+shift".

startRelative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

endRelative.description: Whether the coordinates are relative to the current mouse position.

treatNewLineAsEnter.description: Whether to treat line breaks as enter. If true, any line breaks(\n) in content will be treated as enter key press, and content will be split into multiple lines.

keys.description: Hotkey combination, in xdotool key syntax. Examples: "a", "Return", "alt+Tab", "ctrl+s", "Up", "KP_0" (for the numpad 0 key).

duration.description: Duration in milliseconds. If specified, the hotkey will be held for a while and then released.

oneOf.description: Take a screenshot of the current screen
Indicates the human user should take over the control
Press ONE key down, in xdotool key syntax. Only use this action if hotkey or type cannot satisfy your needs.
Release ONE key, in xdotool key syntax. Only use this action if keydown cannot satisfy your needs and only after a key down.

includeScreenShot.description: Whether to include the screenshot url after action in the response

includeCursorPosition.description: Whether to include the cursor position after action in the response

screenShot.description: The screenshot of the sandbox after the action is executed.

x.description: The x position of the cursor.

y.description: The y position of the cursor.

actionResult.description: The result of the action. Schema is based on the action type and there's no guarantee on the schema. Pass it directly to the LLM if it exists.

includeCursorPosition.description: Whether to include the cursor position after action in the response. On some cursor-less devices, only width and height are meaningful.
